compliance_reasoning: The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document from AIB Life, which is a regulated financial entity in Ireland. Regulation 420 states that failure to comply with the Consumer Protection Regulations is a prescribed contravention. The document itself demonstrates compliance with consumer protection principles by clearly defining terms, explaining how the scheme works, outlining benefits, and detailing the roles and responsibilities of various parties. The document provides transparent information about the pension scheme, which aligns with the requirements for regulated entities to communicate effectively with consumers and act in their best interests.
compliance_evidence: The main purpose of the scheme is to provide benefits for the member's dependants if the member dies before normal retirement age. Except as otherwise provided in the rules, benefits cannot be assigned. The benefits payable under the scheme will be provided by means of an assurance or assurances, to be issued by AIB life.; The scheme is governed by the Pensions Act. The trustee's duties will be regulated by, and carried out, according to the Pensions Act. In particular the trustee must: i. register the scheme with the Pensions Authority and pay any fee that may be required in connection with registering it; ii. give information in relation to the scheme to any person entitled to receive it; and iii. provide certain information in relation to the scheme, as required under the Pensions Act.; The trustee hereby appoints AIB life as registered administrator for the purposes of the Pensions Act. AIB life agrees to prepare, on behalf of the trustee, the annual pension benefit statement for the member.; Saol Assurance d.a.c., trading as AIB life, is regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland. Registered in Ireland number 701277, VAT number 3804332MH.
regulation_title: Failure to comply with these Regulations
regulation_text: 420. A failure by a regulated entity to comply with any requirement or obligation imposed pursuant to these Regulations is a prescribed contravention for the purpose of the administrative sanctions procedure under Part IIIC of the Act of 1942 and may be subject to enforcement action and the imposition of administrative sanctions by the Bank in accordance with that Part.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
